scarifying adjective
(CRITICIZING)
showing strong disapproval of something or someone, especially in an unpleasant or cruel way: The book presents a scarifying, but often bitterly humorous, critique of modern society. He published a scarifying attack on government policy. Synonym
scathing
More examplesFewer examplesShe takes on her opponents with this scarifying piece in today's paper.His main weapons are intelligence, anger, and scarifying wit.
